Welcome to Illinois College Application for Admission! Please login to begin or complete your application. If you have questions or encounter any problems please contact the Office of Admission at
Searching for a college should be one of the most exciting times in your life.
Our Admission staff is dedicated to help you through this process. We have provided a list of links to help you get started. If you cannot locate what you are looking for,
and we will help answer all your questions.

For first-time, first-year students, our Finish in 4 program ensures you will graduate in four years or we will cover the cost of your remaining required courses at IC. With IC’s upfront tuition that includes textbooks, you can focus on your education and never worry about unexpected costs.

Ranked top liberal arts school in Illinois and         13th in the Midwest in America’s Best Bang for         the Buck Colleges 2017 by Washington Monthly.

Follow along through the eyes of an IC student and see what #theIClife is all about! #WhatsGoodAtIC

💯% of IC students participate in experiential learning... aka LOTS of hands-on   being involved! This could be in the form of something like an internship or even doing research with a professor. This prepares you to #GraduateREADY (and what a good resume booster!).
2018 was a great year at Illinois College. Thank you for being part of the journey!! #inspiringachievement
Great things happening with the #agribusiness program here at #IllinoisCollege More growth on the horizon and amazing opportunities to come! 📰bit.ly/2RxJEl9
A group of Illinois College students has appreciated its access to education this semester enough that it’s looking to enable similar opportunities for women in Kenya. #GraduateREADY #ActiveLearning
A $50 million comprehensive campaign focused on initiatives that provide future students the life-changing opportunities Illinois College has long given our alumni.
For Erica Larson ’19, a biology major, the experiences at IC that helped develop her leadership skills were among the most valuable parts of her Illinois College journey.
During her time at Illinois College, Meghan Ruyle ’19 worked with faculty to create a customized plan of study in order to launch a career she is passionate about pursuing.
Brett Palmer ’19 believes that loving what you do will help you succeed in any career.
Nick Montrey ’19 was involved on campus as a member of student senate, a student tutor as well as playing on the football team for a time.

For Karina Donayre ’19, a political science and international studies major, some of the most meaningful experiences of her college career were gained through experiential learning while doing community service.
During his four years at Illinois College, Chas Monge '19 accomplished a lot.
Sarah Christian ’19 officially earned her Illinois College degree in biology, but that didn’t stop her from having hands-on learning opportunities across several departments.
From winning honors on the football field to studying bats in a remote underground cave in western Cuba, JD Roesch ’19 made the most of his time at Illinois College.
Ka-La Harris ’19 says her time at Illinois College taught her to embrace new experiences.
Rolando Salazar ’19 was attracted to IC because it gave him the opportunity to be a student-athlete while actively participating in the communities on campus and around the world.

Kayla Ward ’19 certainly experienced the perks of a liberal arts education as she earned her degree, but she says there is so much more to learn at Illinois College than what is taught in the classrooms.
Lisset Perez Carapia ’19, believes the research opportunities IC provided fueled her love for science.
Paul Hamilton '09, an assistant professor of biology, wants his students to understand the risk and reward in student-faculty research.
Learning at IC doesn’t stop inside the classroom. We believe in and practice experiential learning. These group trips, are led by IC faculty, which take place when classes are not in session.
Searching for a college should be one of the most exciting times in your life.
Our Admission staff is dedicated to help you through this process. We have provided a list of links to help you get started. If you cannot locate what you are looking for,
and we will help answer all your questions.

For first-time, first-year students, our Finish in 4 program ensures you will graduate in four years or we will cover the cost of your remaining required courses at IC. With IC’s upfront tuition that includes textbooks, you can focus on your education and never worry about unexpected costs.

As you explore where you want to invest your next four years, we hope you consider what an education at IC can offer you. You can find IC grads excelling at top graduate programs or kickstarting their careers with the most sought-after companies on the globe. We invite you to Graduate READY to join them.
The first step to your life-changing journey starts here.
We want our students to succeed inside and outside of the classroom, so we look at more than test scores in our review process. And we keep the application process easy and the review process quick.
Complete your application for admission at
During the application process, you will:
Submit your School Report (a reference form completed by your high school counselor).
Send an official high school transcript to Illinois College
Submit test scores (optional for some students)

Searching for a college should be one of the most exciting times in your life. Our admission team is ready to answer any question you have during the application process. We cover the application details so you can explore if Illinois College is a good fit for your future.
